results.title: Mina Tannenbaum
results.creator_credit: Georges Benayoun, Ima Films, LA SFFC, Christian Bourgois Productions, La Sept Cinema, FCC, Les Films de L'Etang and Martine Dugowson
results.brief_description: This debut from director Martine Dugowson is a poignant study of friendship as it stands the test of time. Two French Jewish girls - Ethel and Mina, are begrudgingly thrown together by their mutual lack of ascribing to social conventions in Paris in the late 1960’s. As they move into adolescence their friendship blossoms, becomes the only source of happiness, and sometimes a source of conflict as they move away from their peer groups and family. The film chronicles 25 years of the lives and loves of two best friends who share a love/hate relationship. Cast includes Romane Bohringer, Elsa Zylberstein, Florence Thomassin and Nils Tavernier. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Mimi: an evening with Aboriginal Islander Dance Theatre
results.creator_credit: Reese/Smith Productions, Smith Productions, Andee Reese and Margaret Anne Smith
results.brief_description: Students from the Aboriginal Islander Dance Theatre perform several of their dance pieces which demonstrate their ability to perform modern dance as well as more traditional dance forms, with, at times, an innovative blending of the two.

results.title: Mimi pulka (A)
results.creator_credit: Voice Productions, SBS-TV, Ruth Carr and Catherine Adams
results.brief_description: In an effort to break down existing myths about HIV/AIDS and present the information in a way that was culturally appropriate for Aborigines, the Kimberley Aboriginal Medical Service in Broome commissioned a play entitled “No prejudice” and sent it on tour throughout the Kimberley region. This video follows the touring company of five actors and advisers and highlights the importance of why alternatives to the written word are necessary to a people whose culture is essentially oral.

results.title: Mime over matter
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Sim Productions, Kratky Film and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Examines the use of pantomime to explore ideas and provoke open-ended discussion of such topics as man’s relationship to the material objects that make his life comfortable. Features Ladislav Fialka and his Prague Pantomime.

results.title: MIMA Yearbook. Vol. 3
results.brief_description: Volume three of a three volume set, this video compilation of excerpts of Australian film and video art covers the period from 1983-1986, and is a unique and tantalising entry into the non-mainstream history of Australian film and video.

results.title: Mima
results.creator_credit: Claude Kunetz, Paris New York Production and Philomene Esposito
results.brief_description: Mima is a French teenager living amid her loving extended family in rural France. Among these beautiful surrounds, she finds herself culturally conflicted, especially as her Italian grandfather has strong ties to Calabria. One day however her bucolic existence is shattered when her beloved grandfather is taken away by two mysterious men (Mafiosi) and never returns. Having witnessed the abduction, Mima is capable of identifying the killers, but is mute on the matter, fearing for her family’s lives. Mima is also pressurised to maintain her silence by her father’s killers and their cohorts, who are aware of her knowledge. Set in 1966, “Mima” is a beautifully rendered nostalgia and coming-of-age piece about identity, cultural displacement, family, and belonging. Existing between the worlds of children and adults, Mima can feel the demands of womanhood bearing down upon her as she is forced to make some alarming choices. Cast includes Virginie Ledoyen, Nino Manfredi, Margarita Lozano, Vittoria Scognamiglio and Patrick Bouchitey. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Milliya rumarra = Brand new day (A)
results.creator_credit: I F Productions, W A Filmworkers, Bryan McLellan and David Noakes
results.brief_description: Aboriginal education is a part of life in aboriginal communities and survival of aboriginal culture and language is through the young. This documentary records the celebration of the first Aboriginal Arts in Perth 83 festival which attracted participants from all over Australia, including Maureen Watson, Jack Davis and Vic Hunter. Traditional dance, song and story-telling were a feature and interaction with the audience was encouraged - a way of sharing the Aboriginal culture with non-Aboriginal Australians. The film also documents Aboriginal community members from the Mowanjum Community in Derby, WA and the Warmun Community in Turkey Creek, WA, visiting schools in Perth, teaching the school-children about Aboriginal culture and traditions in an effort to improve race relations and bridge the gap of understanding between all Australians.

results.title: Millionaire for a pound
results.brief_description: A satirical impression without spoken commentary, of Surfers’ Paradise. Opening with colour shots of the idyllic countryside views approaching the town, the film quickly transfers to the gaudiness of the town itself with bizarre signs, neon lights and flashy flats. Features a tape-manipulated mouth organ and Beatniks! Rich with the iconography 60’s Australia, this is a fascinating document of the laconic, innocent charms that then characterised Australia’s favourite seaside idyll. Reminiscent of the surrealist social documentary work of Humphrey Jennings.

results.title: Millhouse: a white comedy
results.creator_credit: White Film Company and Emile de Antonio
results.brief_description: Newsreel and television footage is used to satirise the political career of Richard Millhouse Nixon. The film landed de Antonio on the director on Nixon’s infamous enemy list.

results.title: Miller's Crossing
results.creator_credit: Ethan Coen, Circle Films and Joel Coen
results.brief_description: Millers Crossing contains all the elements of the classic gangster cliches of this genre: fast women, guns and booze. The Coen brothers however have produced a film which is both “stylish and seamless”, and a “hero” who is both a man of principle and a murderer. Starring Albert Finney, Gabriel Byrne and Marcia Gay Harden, “Millers Crossing” tells the tale of Leo, a benevolent Irish gangster and his trusted lieutenant Tom Reagan. Their control is being threatened by the ever-increasing presence of the “Italians”. Caught in the grips of a gangland struggle, Tom must walk a tightrope as he tries to control and manipulate the outcome. The Coen’s have recreated the look and feel of the gangster era with stunning cinematography and a thrilling plot.
